entries.content: East St. Louis Toodle-O (Harlem Twist) was released as by Lonnie Johnson’s Harlem Footwarmers, even though Lonnie Johnson didn't take any part in the session.

entries.content: Vo 15710 was released as by Duke Ellington and His Cotton Club Orchestra. Black Beauty E27093 was mistakenly  released on the Los Angeles pressings of Br 4044 instead of Don’t Mess Around With Me by The Hotsy Totsy Gang (mx E27903), obviously without changing the title on the label.

entries.content: Warren Mills was Irving’s five year old son. According to Victor’s files, the vocal on St. Louis Blues was sung by "Chorus of 10 Mixed Voices (Colored)"; they are not identified. Take 3 of Gems From "Blackbirds of 1928" is instrumental only.
